meaning: The formulation of general concepts from specific instances by abstracting common properties.
example: A hypersphere is a generalization of a sphere across more than three dimensions.

meaning: One who, or that which, generates, begets, causes, or produces.
A product sold under a generic name.
example: "Shrimp" is the generic name for a number of species of sea creature.

meaning: Noble in behaviour or actions; principled, not petty; kind, magnanimous.
example: Thank you for your generous words.

meaning: A kind; a stylistic category or sort, especially of literature or other artworks.
example: The computer game Half-Life redefined the first-person shooter genre.

meaning: A means of escape.
example: They'd been discussing their getaway plans for weeks.

meaning: An item of clothing other than a mitten, covering all or part of the hand and fingers, but usually allowing independent movement of the fingers.
example: I wore gloves to keep my hands warm.

meaning: The forces or behaviours that are the enemy of evil. Usually consists of helping others and general benevolence.
example: The best is the enemy of the good.

meaning: Someone who likes to talk about other people's private or personal business.
example: Be careful what you say to him: he’s a bit of a gossip.

meaning: The action or process of graduating and receiving a diploma for completing a course of study (such as from an educational institution).
A unit of mass equal to one-thousandth of a kilogram. Symbol: g

(applied mathematics) A data chart (graphical representation of data) intended to illustrate the relationship between a set (or sets) of numbers (quantities, measurements or indicative numbers) and a reference set, whose elements are indexed to those of the former set(s) and may or may not be numbers.
A drawing or picture.
example: I've just played this new computer game: the graphics are amazing.

meaning: The making of architectural or design drawings.
example: This game is really fun, but the graphics aren't very good.

meaning: A grating; a grid of wire or a sheet of material with a pattern of holes or slots, usually used to protect something while allowing the passage of air and liquids. Typical uses: to allow air through a fan while preventing fingers or objects from passing; to allow people to talk to somebody, while preventing attack.
example: I put some peppers and mushrooms on the grill to go with dinner.

meaning: (usually groceries) retail foodstuffs and other household supplies.
The act or process of guiding.
example: divine guidance

meaning: (often in the plural) The flesh around the teeth.
A sports facility specialized for lifting weights and exercise.
example: On Wednesdays I hike; on Fridays I gym.

meaning: A large room or building for indoor sports.
One who does something habitually, such as a serial criminal offender.
example: Her habitual lying was the reason for my mistrust.

meaning: One who is expert at programming and solving problems with a computer.
example: a tennis hacker

meaning: A corridor in a building that connects rooms.
A hot sandwich consisting of a patty of cooked ground beef or a meat substitute, in a sliced bun, sometimes also containing salad vegetables, condiments, or both.
example: I'm going to make you into hamburger if you do that again.

meaning: A topically organized book of reference on a certain field of knowledge, regardless of size.
Easy to use, useful.
example: Some people regard duct tape as a handy fix-all.

meaning: Fixtures, equipment, tools and devices used for general-purpose construction and repair of a structure or object. Also such equipment as sold as stock by a store of the same name, e.g. hardware store.
example: military hardware

meaning: Of a person, taking their work seriously and doing it well and rapidly.
Of a kind likely to be damaging; injurious
example: Wear a hat to protect your skin from harmful sunlight.

meaning: The chance of suffering harm; danger, peril, risk of loss.
example: He encountered the enemy at the hazard of his reputation and life.

meaning: Risky, dangerous, with the nature of a hazard.
A pain or ache in the head.
example: The clumsy filing system has been a huge headache.

meaning: A listening device placed or worn in the ear, usually sold in pairs
example: She handed me one headphone so I could listen too.

meaning: To provide (an organization) with headquarters.
The prevention, treatment, and management of illness or the preservation of mental and physical well-being through the services offered by the medical, nursing, and allied health professions.
example: I think free health care should also cover nearsightedness.

meaning: Beneficial to bodily health.
A device that produces and radiates heat, typically to raise the temperature of a room or building.
example: Turn on the heater; I'm cold.

meaning: A protective head covering, usually part of armour.
Near this place; nearby.
example: I hereby declare you husband and wife.

meaning: Tending to hesitate, wait, or proceed with caution or reservation.
example: I am hesitant to recommend him as a manager because he has a short temper.

meaning: An act of hesitating
example: She carried out the order without hesitation.
